trial_identification.studytitle: Improving the style and content of general practice consultations for people with asthma
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Improving the style and content of general practice consultations for people with asthma: a cluster randomised controlled trial

interventions.interventions: GPs receive further training regarding asthma consultations by participating in 3 hours of education (a 2 hour interactive educational session and a 1 hour academic detaling session at their practice location)
interventions.comparator: Control group GPs were waitlisted to receive the educational intervention after completion of the study.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Improvement in GP knowledge/satisfaction with the educational program
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline and after completion of the program

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients with asthma Minimum: age for patients is 55 years Maximum: age for patients - no limit
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Participants not considered competent to give consent

trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation by using a randomisation table created by computer software
trial_design.designfeatures: The aim of this research was to conduct a randomised placebo controlled trial of an asthma education intervention for GPs, addressing the needs of older people with asthma to improve outcomes in this group.
